titles.title: Protect Children From E-Mail Smut Act of 2001
To protect children from unsolicited e-mail smut containing sexually oriented advertisements offensive to minors.

bill.summary: 7/11/2001--Introduced. Protect Children From E-Mail Smut Act of 2001 - Requires the National Institute of Standards and Technology to prescribe marks or notices to be included or affixed to any e-mail forwarded to children that contains a sexually oriented advertisement. Provides fines and penalties for forwarding such e-mail without such marks or notices, as well as civil relief for the parents of affected minors.
